Description: Apache Commons Lang, a package of Java utility classes for the   classes that are in java.lang's hierarchy, or are considered to be so   standard as to justify existence in java.lang.
Vulnerability: Uncontrolled Recursion vulnerability in Apache Commons Lang.  This issue affects Apache Commons Lang: Starting with commons-lang:commons-lang 2.0 to 2.6, and, from org.apache.commons:commons-lang3 3.0 before 3.18.0.  The methods ClassUtils.getClass(...) can throw StackOverflowError on very long inputs. Because an Error is usually not handled by applications and libraries, a  StackOverflowError could cause an application to stop.  Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.18.0, which fixes the issue.  Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2025-48924 for details
